intro: Hasseltiopsis mucronata, commonly known as the slender rock cress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, alternate leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Native to arid and rocky environments, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Its flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees.
